name: USCoreCarePlanProfile
title: US Core CarePlan Profile
description: This profile sets minimum expectations for the CarePlan resource to record, search, and fetch assessment and plan of treatment data associated with a patient to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation. It identifies which core elements, extensions, vocabularies, and value sets **SHALL** be present and constrains the way the elements are used when using the profile. It provides the floor for standards development for specific use cases.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: (USCDI) Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: status
elements.description: The status of the narrative - whether it's entirely generated (from just the defined data or the extensions too), or whether a human authored it and it may contain additional data.

binding.description: Constrained value set of narrative statuses.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: div
elements.description: The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

The narrative SHALL contain only the basic html formatting elements and attributes described in chapters 7-11 (except section 4 of chapter 9) and 15 of the HTML 4.0 standard, <a> elements (either name or href), images and internally contained style attributes
The narrative SHALL have some non-whitespace content

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: Business identifiers assigned to this care plan by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: instantiatesCanonical
elements.description: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: instantiatesUri
elements.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: basedOn
elements.description: A care plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this care plan.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: replaces
elements.description: Completed or terminated care plan whose function is taken by this new care plan.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: partOf
elements.description: A larger care plan of which this particular care plan is a component or step.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.short: (USCDI) draft | active | on-hold | revoked | completed | entered-in-error | unknown
elements.description: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.

binding.description: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .statusCode planned = new active = active completed = completed

elements.name: intent
elements.description: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the care plan and where the care plan fits into the workflow chain.

binding.description: Codes indicating the degree of authority/intentionality associated with a care plan

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: category
elements.description: Type of plan.

binding.description: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: category
elements.description: Type of plan.

binding.description: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: title
elements.short: Human-friendly name for the care plan
elements.description: Human-friendly name for the care plan.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.description: A description of the scope and nature of the plan.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: subject
elements.short: (USCDI) Who the care plan is for
elements.description: Who care plan is for.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: encounter
elements.description: The Encounter during which this CarePlan was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: period
elements.description: Indicates when the plan did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: created
elements.description: Represents when this particular CarePlan record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: author
elements.short: Who is the designated responsible party
elements.description: When populated, the author is responsible for the care plan.  The care plan is attributed to the author.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contributor
elements.short: Who provided the content of the care plan
elements.description: Identifies the individual(s) or organization who provided the contents of the care plan.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: careTeam
elements.description: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care envisioned by this plan.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Request.performer {similar but does not entail CareTeam}

elements.name: addresses
elements.description: Identifies the conditions/problems/concerns/diagnoses/etc. whose management and/or mitigation are handled by this plan.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: supportingInfo
elements.short: Information considered as part of plan
elements.description: Identifies portions of the patient's record that specifically influenced the formation of the plan.  These might include comorbidities, recent procedures, limitations, recent assessments, etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: goal
elements.description: Describes the intended objective(s) of carrying out the care plan.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: activity
elements.short: Action to occur as part of plan
elements.description: Identifies a planned action to occur as part of the plan.  For example, a medication to be used, lab tests to perform, self-monitoring, education, etc.

constraints.human: Provide a reference or detail, not both
All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map:
{no mapping
NOTE: This is a list of contained Request-Event tuples!}

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: outcomeCodeableConcept
elements.description: Identifies the outcome at the point when the status of the activity is assessed.  For example, the outcome of an education activity could be patient understands (or not).

binding.description: Identifies the results of the activity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: outcomeReference
elements.description: Details of the outcome or action resulting from the activity.  The reference to an "event" resource, such as Procedure or Encounter or Observation, is the result/outcome of the activity itself.  The activity can be conveyed using CarePlan.activity.detail OR using the CarePlan.activity.reference (a reference to a “request” resource).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: {Event that is outcome of Request in activity.reference}

elements.name: progress
elements.description: Notes about the adherence/status/progress of the activity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reference
elements.short: Activity details defined in specific resource
elements.description: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: {Request that resulted in Event in activity.actionResulting}

elements.name: detail
elements.description: A simple summary of a planned activity suitable for a general care plan system (e.g. form driven) that doesn't know about specific resources such as procedure etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: kind
elements.short: Appointment | CommunicationRequest | DeviceRequest | MedicationRequest | NutritionOrder | Task | ServiceRequest | VisionPrescription
elements.description: A description of the kind of resource the in-line definition of a care plan activity is representing.  The CarePlan.activity.detail is an in-line definition when a resource is not referenced using CarePlan.activity.reference.  For example, a MedicationRequest, a ServiceRequest, or a CommunicationRequest.

binding.description: Resource types defined as part of FHIR that can be represented as in-line definitions of a care plan activity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: instantiatesCanonical
elements.description: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan activity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: instantiatesUri
elements.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan activity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: code
elements.description: Detailed description of the type of planned activity; e.g. what lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

binding.description: Detailed description of the type of activity; e.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reasonCode
elements.short: Why activity should be done or why activity was prohibited
elements.description: Provides the rationale that drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan or the reason why the activity was prohibited.

binding.description: Identifies why a care plan activity is needed.  Can include any health condition codes as well as such concepts as "general wellness", prophylaxis, surgical preparation, etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reasonReference
elements.description: Indicates another resource, such as the health condition(s), whose existence justifies this request and drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: goal
elements.description: Internal reference that identifies the goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.short: not-started | scheduled | in-progress | on-hold | completed | cancelled | stopped | unknown | entered-in-error
elements.description: Identifies what progress is being made for the specific activity.

binding.description: Codes that reflect the current state of a care plan activity within its overall life cycle.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .statusCode not-started = new scheduled = not-started (and fulfillment relationship to appointent) in-progress = active on-hold = suspended completed = completed cancelled = aborted

elements.name: statusReason
elements.description: Provides reason why the activity isn't yet started, is on hold, was cancelled, etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: doNotPerform
elements.short: If true, activity is prohibiting action
elements.description: If true, indicates that the described activity is one that must NOT be engaged in when following the plan.  If false, or missing, indicates that the described activity is one that should be engaged in when following the plan.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: scheduled[x]
elements.description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: location
elements.description: Identifies the facility where the activity will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: performer
elements.description: Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: PRT-5 : ( PRV-4 = (provider participations)); PRT-5 : ( PRV-4 = (non-provider person participations )) ; PRT-5 : ( PRV-4 = (patient non-subject of care) ) ; PRT-8

elements.name: product[x]
elements.description: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

binding.description: A product supplied or administered as part of a care plan activity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: dailyAmount
elements.description: Identifies the quantity expected to be consumed in a given day.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: quantity
elements.description: Identifies the quantity expected to be supplied, administered or consumed by the subject.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: RXO-11 / RXE-10 / RXD-4 / RXG-5 / RXA-6 /  TQ1-2.1  *and*  RXO-12 /  RXE-11 / RXD-5 / RXG-7 / RXA-7 / TQ1-2.2

elements.name: description
elements.short: Extra info describing activity to perform
elements.description: This provides a textual description of constraints on the intended activity occurrence, including relation to other activities.  It may also include objectives, pre-conditions and end-conditions.  Finally, it may convey specifics about the activity such as body site, method, route, etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: note
elements.description: General notes about the care plan not covered elsewhere.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
